website_summaries.verdict: Chances are they will provide long wear under performance-level driving conditions; otherwise they aren't the best choice for most drivers.
pros: Great qualities for performance vehicle enthusiasts, including high-temp compound materials that hold up to wear, reliable braking power under most conditions, and easy-to-install design
cons: Tend to produce a bit of brake dust under some driving conditions
On the higher end of the price spectrum

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to OEM Bremo brake pads!
customer_reviews.text: I used these as replacements for my Subaru STI. The OEM Brembo pads are overpriced so I decided to give StopTech a try. I have purchased a couple brake components from them so I know they are a reputable company. I can honestly say that they have the same bite as the Brembos. I have not raced with them so I am not sure of the heat fade resistance. I have raced with my old set of Brembos and I wasn't really a fan of how fast they heat faded. After one autocross run they (Brembo) started smoking. These are a great alternative to the OEM pads!
customer_reviews.author: AutoxSTI

customer_reviews.title: Loud Squeal
customer_reviews.text: They squeal so loud. It's embarrassing. I used an abundant amount of brake grease on them and they still squeal..well they've squealed since the beginning. Stopping power isn't great either. Guess you get what you pay for..already gonna get new pads now after 4k miles
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod T.

customer_reviews.title: Decent brake pads with lots of brake dust and short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: My OEM brake pads lasted 150k miles on my Cadillac XTS, these only lasted 30k before being down to the metal. They also produce a lot of brake dust and can be squeaky at times. Go with the original brembos.
customer_reviews.author: Zahoor Sadiq

customer_reviews.title: I find the Hawk HPS to be better in the stopping department
customer_reviews.text: Solid brakes for the price. Decent stopping power and decent dusting. I find the Hawk HPS to be better in the stopping department, but they dust like no other. It's a good trade off if you're looking for more stopping power. For a daily driver, these are more than enough. Installed on a 2005 Subaru WRX.
customer_reviews.author: R. Echavarria

customer_reviews.title: great product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, I was able to install both front and back brakes with a friend in just under two hours. So far, the initial bite inst that hard but they stop you on a dime when you need them too. They are still pretty smooth though which is great. I installed these on my 2011 STi hatch
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B.

customer_reviews.title: Not for Motorheads
customer_reviews.text: These are very quiet. But if your looking for "performance" braking with a bite. Look else where... first everyday use they are fine. I got an evo and after spirited driving the pads lose bite. But on the plus side. They are quiet for everyday normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Felix R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pads
customer_reviews.text: I had EBC Redstuff before and these perform better for half the price.Compared with Redstuff they produce more dust ,but it's acceptable, your wheels will still be clean . Braking power-excellent with no signs of fade at high speeds Dust Level-low to moderate Durability-N/A as I have them for just a week...will update later. Installed on a 2010 Camaro SS
customer_reviews.author: WHO?

customer_reviews.title: Evedently that's not a bad thing.
customer_reviews.text: Seem to last really long on my car... Evedently that's not a bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Harriott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Brake Pads
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Brake Pads!!! I replaced my stock front brake pads on my 2015 Subaru WRX STI with these Stoptech Sports and they are awesome; smooth braking and no noise. Definitely get these pads over your standard OEM brake pads
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Average performance, decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used these on my 2009 Subaru STI. Replaced both pads/rotors at the time. These StopTechs were replacing Hawk HPS pads. I was hoping for less dust yet similar performance to the Hawk pads. They delivered on less dust and even noise but they don't stop as well as the HPS. Have yet to track so cannot comment on track performance. Have gone over mountain passes and brakes felt good on the downhill, no fade. Pros: Cheap Upgrade over OEM, raybestos Quiet Not too dusty Cons: Low initial bite Average stopping power 4,000 miles on them so far. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Louis B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good alternative to Subaru OEM although they lacked wear indicators.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive noise makers
customer_reviews.text: I expected better from stop tech, these are the noisiest pads I've ever put on any car of mine. I'm an ase certified technician and even tried re-machining the rotors to remove the awful noise. Guess I'm buying cheap pads to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gobble

customer_reviews.title: Excellent street pad for the $!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent street pad! Low dust, no noise and just as good, if not better than most of the so called "aggressive, light auto cross/track" pads for driving day to day on public roads.
customer_reviews.author: Drei24x7

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price, they were some customer returns. Should work great on my Genesis Coupe with the Brembos.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Great pad!
customer_reviews.text: Great pads with good initial bite. Just be worn that they are a dusty pad
customer_reviews.author: Victor R.

customer_reviews.title: ... with Centric rotors for my Evo and these did amazing around the track
customer_reviews.text: I paired these up with Centric rotors for my Evo and these did amazing around the track. A little too heavy on the brake dust, but that's a price I'm willing to pay for this kind of performance!
customer_reviews.author: Nick C

customer_reviews.title: ... pads two months ago and they are quiet and pretty
customer_reviews.text: Installed the pads two months ago and they are quiet and pretty clean
customer_reviews.author: Phil C.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fitment for a 2013 Hyundai Genesis 2.0 Rspec. Instead of paying $350+ dollars for Brembo Pads at the stealership get these and save some money
customer_reviews.author: Hargow

customer_reviews.title: They work, but squeal soo bad!
customer_reviews.text: These pads squeal like not tomorrow. Esp under 50 degrees. Used for mild track session , held up fine. These need to be at higher operating temp to get best performance. Work when cold , just soo loud!
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Very good stopping power and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Very good stopping power and very quiet, especially for the price. The only reason it doesn't get a fifth star is because there is significant brake dust not excessive but I wish it were less.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great pads.
customer_reviews.text: Low noise, low dust, initial bite is better than stock and stopping is firm and predictable. Can't speak for longevity or track behavior yet. So far very happy with them on my '04 Cadillac CTS-V.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Changed both axles approximately 3 weeks ago. No noise, not heavy on brake dust-great stopping.
customer_reviews.author: Drizztace25

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Many thx for the excellent service. I reccomend thhes br pads for everyone appriciating good performance/price ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: have really good grip, and went right in
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 2011 Subaru Impreza STI. They are quiet, have really good grip, and went right in. I'm happy :)
customer_reviews.author: J. McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Great pads
customer_reviews.text: Great combo with centric high carbon rotors for 2009 STI.... Very affordable combo compared to Dealers price and easy to DYI!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, great stopping power even when hot on my 2005 Volvo S60R.
customer_reviews.author: anasynpunk

customer_reviews.title: Love these Brakes
customer_reviews.text: Definitely great braking ability, the only downside is that it creates a lot of brake dust on my sti, but I don't mind it since I wash my car decently often. I would recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Kata

customer_reviews.title: Evo 9
customer_reviews.text: So far no squeal and stop way better then magic pads. These will be my new DD pad.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: They stopped the car fine, but after 20 miles of driving the brake ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2011 Camaro SS. I had them professionally installed. They stopped the car fine, but after 20 miles of driving the brake squeek very loud. Its embarrassing at every stop. I never had this problem with the ceramic pads i used prior.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: No sounds, tons of dust...
customer_reviews.text: Could be better. So much break dust is created with these but barely any sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Henriquez

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2014 Z51 Corvette perfectly. Not quite as much stopping power as OEM, but a heck of a lot less dust
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I haven't noticed any issues outside of a little squeaking here and there.
customer_reviews.author: cnr2011

customer_reviews.title: 08 Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution X GSR
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, fit perfectly, performs great and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Erik M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Pump those brakes after installation
customer_reviews.text: Mostdef (most defiantly) and upgrade from the OEM Brakes. Didn't have to break in brakes. Once I installed new brakes, started up my 2012 STI, pressed down brake pedal, brake pedal went to the floor (as expected), pumped brake pedal 5x brake pressure, 5th pump pressed down hard and held it there for about 2mins. Drove about 115mph and smashed down the pedal. Came to a stop very quickly. Glad I didnt have to take a poop.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, grabs very well, and a whole lot less expensive than OEM brake pads from the dealership.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Noob

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace my Evo X's Brembos.. these don't have the "bite" feeling that the Brembo pads have. The brake pedal pressure feel is just constantly the same, as you push it further down it doesn't have the "bite" feeling where it's ready to stop on a dime. For it's price, it'll do the job, but for a car meant to be driven fast.. I'm not confident with these. My opinion, save a little more and get Brembo pads. I've heard good things about Hawks and Ferodos too, but I haven't used them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not good
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, and they squeal, after properly installing them. Spend a few more $$ and get good ones.... decent for the price i guess...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stops my car and brake dust is minimal. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: @WestonCPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Good Pads
customer_reviews.text: Installed on 2004 Acura TL (6 speed) . Work really well so far - quiet, no vibration, and good stopping power. Only complain so far is that it generates lots of brake dust.
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil Sheth

customer_reviews.title: Really good breaking power
customer_reviews.text: Really good breaking power, the do not fade easily, but they leave a LOT of dust, my wheels are grey and it still bothers me.
customer_reviews.author: Thiago

customer_reviews.title: Great pads overall
customer_reviews.text: Great pads overall. Just tons of brake dust. After a couple days of driving you can see it. No noise. Performance is great. Dust is only con
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Wysocki

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the Buck $$$
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as expected. Brakes where easy install in my 04 STi with no problems once so ever. First thought of the breaking was ok, was expecting more bight. But after a mikes 25+ miles of driving city roads the bight became better and the harder you press the harder they bite. great pads best bang for the buck. Only paid $67 for these hawks pads are $100 so I saved some $$$ on this. I'm yet to upgrade to steal braided lines and better brake fluid for the best breaking power. Most definitely recommend these for street use.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: I use these as my daily and perform great under aggressive driving or for the occasional track days
customer_reviews.text: I use these as my daily and perform great under aggressive driving or for the occasional track days. If planning more than the 3-4 times a year track day, I suggest a more aggressive brake pad such as the Hawk HP+ or similar. Other than that, great for daily driving but it does have a good amount of brake dust.
customer_reviews.author: dot.dot.dot.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding brakes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2007 Acura TL Type-S, and can't say enough good about them. They do a better job than the OEM pads, IMO, and considerably cut down on brake dust. Seriously, the OEM pads used to cake my wheels with dust. The fact that they are also MUCH cheaper than OEM Honda pads is another huge plus. I'll be using StopTech for both my car and my wife's SUV from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Panaccio

customer_reviews.title: Not "low dust" at all.
customer_reviews.text: These pads were listed as low dust. They are anything but that. More dust than the old semi-metallic ones and its a very dark brown color. It comes off a bit easier than the old OEM ones but the car looks like a Jalopy. 2004 CTS-V with Brembo Calipers. Going with PowerStop this time instead.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brakes. Car stops well even when cold
customer_reviews.text: Amazing brakes. Car stops well even when cold. I have bought these pads for the second car and recommended them to two of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Jacome

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't very fun to find out when my car was in the ...
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR STOCK WRX: My beef is with Amazons "fits your car" descriptor. I order these and they defiantly don't fit my WRX stock brakes. After looking closer, these are for Brembo's for the STI. It wasn't very fun to find out when my car was in the air. I had to walk 2 miles to the nearest autozone and get pads I didn't necessarily want. Boo amazon. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: chris ruhland

customer_reviews.title: Work well on Evo 9 but...
customer_reviews.text: Work well but are very noisy. Good for track use and light auto X but that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to Brembo
customer_reviews.text: Decent pad, very soft feel. doesn't bite rotor very well compared to the original semi-metallic Brembo pad. Stopping distance is reduced. The Stoptech pads are however much quieter with almost no brake dust. For 70$ it is a good deal and fairly high quality pad.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: bought this product under recommendation from amazon that it fits ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this product under recommendation from amazon that it fits my 2012 Lancer, it does not. pads are for evolution brake systems or similar.
customer_reviews.author: keiston coard

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT'S PICTURED
customer_reviews.text: These are not the pads pictured and it was annoying because it said it was compatible with my Subaru however the pads are not as pictures. Usually a fan but incredibly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: WRONG PART
customer_reviews.text: These are not the brake pads that are displayed in the picture. These are actually the larger brake pads that are intended for the STI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: didn't fit at all
customer_reviews.text: does not fit a subaru impreza 2.5i wish i could return it but missed the window really sucks yes sucks
customer_reviews.author: Mad Scientist

product_meta.title: StopTech 309.10010 Street Performance Front Brake Pad
product_meta.description: Significant brake performance improvements using the factory calipers and pre-matched, direct-replacement (OEM) sized components. This StopTech Sport Axle Pack includes cross-drilled StopTech Sport Rotors, StopTech Sport Pads and StopTech Stainless Steel Lines.
feature_bullets: Perfect for spirited street and light track use, scorched pad surface delivers a positive bite even when pads are cold
High-temperature compound ensures consistent performance and even pad wear
Rotor-friendly low-dust formulation makes for cleaner wheels, factory-style shims virtually eliminate pad-vibration noise
Perfect factory fit, thanks to precision-cut backing plates. This item does not fit 2008 Subaru Impreza WRX

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars98 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
